list_definition.definition: (especially in the forces) to raise the (usually right) hand to the forehead to show respect
to honour by firing eg large guns

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They saluted the Queen by firing one hundred guns.

list_ex_of_english: The poem's coda salutes the power of the transformative imagination to recover meaning in the world from all we see and remember.
He expected every officer to be punctilious in saluting religious processions as they passed in the streets.
Training is of a mass kind, drilling, marching, saluting, and getting men into the physical condition to endure and into a frame of mind to obey.
I hope that some of my colleagues will join me in saluting the progress that has been made.
All they seem concerned about is saluting and blanco-ing.
The greeting namaskar is founded on the principle that one salutes the spark of the divine in the other.
One remembers being told most carefully that as an officer one is saluted not because of one's position but because of the commission that one holds.
I hope that we may meet gladly in saluting the best of religious broadcasting and leave aside unworthy attacks on religious advisers, who serve us very well.
